item.title: Making item staf fonly
item.dc:creator: @xstrxpurez xstrxpurez
item.description:
@xstrxpurez wrote:

idiots…

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == #### && playerRights < 1); { remove(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == ####); } else { if playerRights = 0; sendMessage("You must be a mod to wield this item"); }

that is what it should be close to…

u can change the playerWeapon to Body, Cape, Hat, Ring, etc… if u want other items.

item.title: Making item staf fonly
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:8, topic:241741”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=318104.msg2523017#msg2523017 date=1226020291]

okay i fixed that but whats this mean?

client.java:23280: cannot find symbol symbol : variable wearID location: class client if(wearID == 7449 && playerRights < 1) ^

lol you have to add the wearID not type “wearID” in it…uuum heres a expample…

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 7449 && playerRights < 1)

[/quote]
No, I’m talking about the item ID sent to the server by the client.
That would check their current equipment prior to the item being worn, which wouldn’t work.[/quote]

Well it could work like this

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 7449 && playerRights < 1); {
remove(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 7449);
sendMessage("nigga no!");
}

Read full topic
